<script>
  (function() {
    // === DEBUG MODE ===
    var CKY_DEBUG = false;

    function log(msg, data) {
      if (CKY_DEBUG) {
        var prefix = '[CookieYes Debug]';
        if (data !== undefined) {
          console.log(prefix, msg, data);
        } else {
          console.log(prefix, msg);
        }
      }
    }

    var ckyStylesBackup = null;

    // Load CookieYes script on initial page load
    function loadCookieYes() {
      if (!document.getElementById('cookieyes')) {
        log('Loading CookieYes script...');
        var script = document.createElement('script');
        script.id = 'cookieyes';
        script.type = 'text/javascript';
        script.src = 'https://cdn-cookieyes.com/client_data/d2e859934c4309be824ea8bb/script.js';
        document.head.appendChild(script);
      } else {
        log('CookieYes script already exists, skipping load');
      }
    }

    // Watch for CookieYes styles to be added and back them up
    var observer = new MutationObserver(function(mutations) {
      var ckyStyle = document.getElementById('cky-style');
      if (ckyStyle && !ckyStylesBackup) {
        ckyStylesBackup = ckyStyle.innerHTML;
        log('Captured CookieYes styles, length:', ckyStylesBackup.length + ' chars');
      }
    });
    observer.observe(document.head, { childList: true });

    // Restore CookieYes styles after instant navigation if missing
    function restoreCkyStyles() {
      var ckyStyle = document.getElementById('cky-style');
      var bannerExists = document.querySelector('.cky-consent-container, .cky-btn-revisit-wrapper');

      log('Navigation detected - checking styles...', {
        stylesExist: !!ckyStyle,
        bannerExists: !!bannerExists,
        backupAvailable: !!ckyStylesBackup
      });

      if (!ckyStyle && ckyStylesBackup) {
        var style = document.createElement('style');
        style.id = 'cky-style';
        style.innerHTML = ckyStylesBackup;
        document.head.appendChild(style);
        log('Restored CookieYes styles successfully');
      } else if (ckyStyle) {
        log('Styles already present, no restore needed');
      } else if (!ckyStylesBackup) {
        log('WARNING: No backup available to restore!');
      }
    }

    // Initial load
    document.addEventListener('DOMContentLoaded', function() {
      log('DOMContentLoaded fired');
      loadCookieYes();
    });

    // Subscribe to MkDocs Material's document$ observable for instant navigation
    // document$ is available after the theme's JS loads
    var checkCount = 0;
    var checkInterval = setInterval(function() {
      checkCount++;
      if (typeof document$ !== 'undefined') {
        clearInterval(checkInterval);
        log('Found document$ observable after ' + checkCount + ' checks');
        document$.subscribe(function() {
          log('document$ emitted (page navigation/load)');
          restoreCkyStyles();
        });
      }
    }, 100);

    // Fallback: stop checking after 10 seconds
    setTimeout(function() {
      if (checkInterval) {
        clearInterval(checkInterval);
        log('WARNING: document$ not found after 10 seconds - instant nav support disabled');
      }
    }, 10000);

    // Expose debug helpers to window for console access
    window.__ckyDebug = {
      getBackup: function() { return ckyStylesBackup; },
      getBackupLength: function() { return ckyStylesBackup ? ckyStylesBackup.length : 0; },
      checkStyles: function() {
        var ckyStyle = document.getElementById('cky-style');
        var banner = document.querySelector('.cky-consent-container, .cky-btn-revisit-wrapper');
        return {
          stylesInDOM: !!ckyStyle,
          stylesLength: ckyStyle ? ckyStyle.innerHTML.length : 0,
          bannerInDOM: !!banner,
          backupLength: ckyStylesBackup ? ckyStylesBackup.length : 0
        };
      },
      forceRestore: function() {
        restoreCkyStyles();
      }
    };
    log('Debug helpers available at window.__ckyDebug');
  })();

<a href="#langgraph_sdk.client" class="headerlink" title="Copy anchor link to this section for reference">&para;</a></h2>

    <div class="doc doc-contents first">

        <p>The LangGraph client implementations connect to the LangGraph API.</p>
<p>This module provides both asynchronous (<code>get_client(url="http://localhost:2024")</code> or
<code>LangGraphClient</code>) and synchronous (<code>get_sync_client(url="http://localhost:2024")</code> or
<code>SyncLanggraphClient</code>) clients to interacting with the LangGraph API's core resources
such as Assistants, Threads, Runs, and Cron jobs, as well as its persistent document
Store.</p>

<h3 id="langgraph_sdk.client.ThreadsClient" class="doc doc-heading">
<code class="doc-symbol doc-symbol-heading doc-symbol-class"></code>            <span class="doc doc-object-name doc-class-name">ThreadsClient</span>


<a href="#langgraph_sdk.client.ThreadsClient" class="headerlink" title="Copy anchor link to this section for reference">&para;</a></h3>


    <div class="doc doc-contents ">



        <p>Client for managing threads in LangGraph.</p>
<p>A thread maintains the state of a graph across multiple interactions/invocations (aka runs).
It accumulates and persists the graph's state, allowing for continuity between separate
invocations of the graph.</p>
<details class="example" open="open">
<summary>Example</summary>

</span><span id="__span-0-2"><a id="__codelineno-0-2" name="__codelineno-0-2" href="#__codelineno-0-2"></a><span class="n">new_thread</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="k">await</span> <span class="n">client</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">threads</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">create</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">metadata</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="p">{</span><span class="s2">&quot;user_id&quot;</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="s2">&quot;123&quot;</span><span class="p">})</span>
</span></code></pre></div>

<h3 id="langgraph_sdk.client.RunsClient" class="doc doc-heading">
<code class="doc-symbol doc-symbol-heading doc-symbol-class"></code>            <span class="doc doc-object-name doc-class-name">RunsClient</span>


<a href="#langgraph_sdk.client.RunsClient" class="headerlink" title="Copy anchor link to this section for reference">&para;</a></h3>


    <div class="doc doc-contents ">



        <p>Client for managing runs in LangGraph.</p>
<p>A run is a single assistant invocation with optional input, config, context, and metadata.
This client manages runs, which can be stateful (on threads) or stateless.</p>
<details class="example" open="open">
<summary>Example</summary>

    <div class="doc doc-contents ">

        <p>Create a run and stream the results.</p>


<table>
      <thead>
        <tr>
          <th><span class="doc-section-title">PARAMETER</span></th>
          <th><span>DESCRIPTION</span></th>
        </tr>
      </thead>
      <tbody>
          <tr class="doc-section-item">
            <td>
                <code>thread_id</code>
            </td>
            <td class="doc-param-details">
              <div class="doc-md-description">
                <p>the thread ID to assign to the thread.
If <code>None</code> will create a stateless run.</p>
              </div>
              <p>
                  <span class="doc-param-annotation">
                    <b>TYPE:</b>
                      <code><a class="autorefs autorefs-external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str" target="_blank" rel="noopener">str</a> | None</code>
                  </span>
              </p>
            </td>
          </tr>
          <tr class="doc-section-item">
            <td>
                <code>assistant_id</code>
            </td>
            <td class="doc-param-details">
              <div class="doc-md-description">
                <p>The assistant ID or graph name to stream from.
If using graph name, will default to first assistant created from that graph.</p>
              </div>
              <p>
                  <span class="doc-param-annotation">
                    <b>TYPE:</b>
                      <code><a class="autorefs autorefs-external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str" target="_blank" rel="noopener">str</a></code>
                  </span>
              </p>
            </td>
          </tr>
          <tr class="doc-section-item">
            <td>
                <code>input</code>
            </td>
            <td class="doc-param-details">
              <div class="doc-md-description">
                <p>The input to the graph.</p>
              </div>
              <p>
                  <span class="doc-param-annotation">
                    <b>TYPE:</b>
                      <code><span title="langgraph_sdk.schema.Input">Input</span> | None</code>
                  </span>
                  <span class="doc-param-default">
                    <b>DEFAULT:</b>
                      <code>None</code>
                  </span>
              </p>
            </td>
          </tr>
          <tr class="doc-section-item">
            <td>
                <code>command</code>
            </td>
            <td class="doc-param-details">
              <div class="doc-md-description">
                <p>A command to execute. Cannot be combined with input.</p>
              </div>
              <p>

        <p>Create a background run.</p>

        <p>Create a run, wait until it finishes and return the final state.</p>

<h3 id="langgraph_sdk.client.CronClient" class="doc doc-heading">
<code class="doc-symbol doc-symbol-heading doc-symbol-class"></code>            <span class="doc doc-object-name doc-class-name">CronClient</span>


<a href="#langgraph_sdk.client.CronClient" class="headerlink" title="Copy anchor link to this section for reference">&para;</a></h3>


    <div class="doc doc-contents ">



        <p>Client for managing recurrent runs (cron jobs) in LangGraph.</p>
<p>A run is a single invocation of an assistant with optional input, config, and context.
This client allows scheduling recurring runs to occur automatically.</p>
<details class="example" open="open">
<summary>Example Usage</summary>
<div class="language-python highlight"><pre><span></span><code><span id="__span-0-1"><a id="__codelineno-0-1" name="__codelineno-0-1" href="#__codelineno-0-1"></a><span class="n">client</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">get_client</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">url</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s2">&quot;http://localhost:2024&quot;</span><span class="p">))</span>
</span><span id="__span-0-2"><a id="__codelineno-0-2" name="__codelineno-0-2" href="#__codelineno-0-2"></a><span class="n">cron_job</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="k">await</span> <span class="n">client</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">crons</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">create_for_thread</span><span class="p">(</span>
</span><span id="__span-0-3"><a id="__codelineno-0-3" name="__codelineno-0-3" href="#__codelineno-0-3"></a>    <span class="n">thread_id</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s2">&quot;thread_123&quot;</span><span class="p">,</span>
</span><span id="__span-0-4"><a id="__codelineno-0-4" name="__codelineno-0-4" href="#__codelineno-0-4"></a>    <span class="n">assistant_id</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s2">&quot;asst_456&quot;</span><span class="p">,</span>
</span><span id="__span-0-5"><a id="__codelineno-0-5" name="__codelineno-0-5" href="#__codelineno-0-5"></a>    <span class="n">schedule</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s2">&quot;0 9 * * *&quot;</span><span class="p">,</span>
</span><span id="__span-0-6"><a id="__codelineno-0-6" name="__codelineno-0-6" href="#__codelineno-0-6"></a>    <span class="nb">input</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="p">{</span><span class="s2">&quot;message&quot;</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="s2">&quot;Daily update&quot;</span><span class="p">}</span>
</span><span id="__span-0-7"><a id="__codelineno-0-7" name="__codelineno-0-7" href="#__codelineno-0-7"></a><span class="p">)</span>
</span></code></pre></div>
</details>
<div class="admonition note">
<p class="admonition-title">Feature Availability</p>
<p>The crons client functionality is not supported on all licenses.
Please check the relevant license documentation for the most up-to-date
details on feature availability.</p>
</div>

<h3 id="langgraph_sdk.client.StoreClient" class="doc doc-heading">
<code class="doc-symbol doc-symbol-heading doc-symbol-class"></code>            <span class="doc doc-object-name doc-class-name">StoreClient</span>


<a href="#langgraph_sdk.client.StoreClient" class="headerlink" title="Copy anchor link to this section for reference">&para;</a></h3>


    <div class="doc doc-contents ">



        <p>Client for interacting with the graph's shared storage.</p>
<p>The Store provides a key-value storage system for persisting data across graph executions,
allowing for stateful operations and data sharing across threads.</p>
<details class="example" open="open">
<summary>Example</summary>
<div class="language-python highlight"><pre><span></span><code><span id="__span-0-1"><a id="__codelineno-0-1" name="__codelineno-0-1" href="#__codelineno-0-1"></a><span class="n">client</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">get_client</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">url</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s2">&quot;http://localhost:2024&quot;</span><span class="p">)</span>
</span><span id="__span-0-2"><a id="__codelineno-0-2" name="__codelineno-0-2" href="#__codelineno-0-2"></a><span class="k">await</span> <span class="n">client</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">store</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">put_item</span><span class="p">([</span><span class="s2">&quot;users&quot;</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s2">&quot;user123&quot;</span><span class="p">],</span> <span class="s2">&quot;mem-123451342&quot;</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="p">{</span><span class="s2">&quot;name&quot;</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="s2">&quot;Alice&quot;</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s2">&quot;score&quot;</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="mi">100</span><span class="p">})</span>
</span></code></pre></div>

    <div class="doc doc-contents ">



        <p>Synchronous client for interacting with the LangGraph API.</p>
<p>This class provides synchronous access to LangGraph API endpoints for managing
assistants, threads, runs, cron jobs, and data storage.</p>

<h3 id="langgraph_sdk.client.SyncAssistantsClient" class="doc doc-heading">
<code class="doc-symbol doc-symbol-heading doc-symbol-class"></code>            <span class="doc doc-object-name doc-class-name">SyncAssistantsClient</span>


<a href="#langgraph_sdk.client.SyncAssistantsClient" class="headerlink" title="Copy anchor link to this section for reference">&para;</a></h3>


    <div class="doc doc-contents ">



        <p>Client for managing assistants in LangGraph synchronously.</p>
<p>This class provides methods to interact with assistants, which are versioned configurations of your graph.</p>

<p>This class provides methods to create, retrieve, and manage runs, which represent
individual executions of graphs.</p>

    <div class="doc doc-contents ">

        <p>Create a run and stream the results.</p>


<table>
      <thead>
        <tr>
          <th><span class="doc-section-title">PARAMETER</span></th>
          <th><span>DESCRIPTION</span></th>
        </tr>
      </thead>
      <tbody>
          <tr class="doc-section-item">
            <td>
                <code>thread_id</code>
            </td>
            <td class="doc-param-details">
              <div class="doc-md-description">
                <p>the thread ID to assign to the thread.
If <code>None</code> will create a stateless run.</p>
              </div>
              <p>
                  <span class="doc-param-annotation">
                    <b>TYPE:</b>
                      <code><a class="autorefs autorefs-external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str" target="_blank" rel="noopener">str</a> | None</code>
                  </span>
              </p>
            </td>
          </tr>

            <td>
                <code>assistant_id</code>
            </td>
            <td class="doc-param-details">
              <div class="doc-md-description">
                <p>The assistant ID or graph name to stream from.
If using graph name, will default to first assistant created from that graph.</p>
              </div>
              <p>
                  <span class="doc-param-annotation">
                    <b>TYPE:</b>
                      <code><a class="autorefs autorefs-external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str" target="_blank" rel="noopener">str</a></code>

              </p>

              </div>

                    <b>TYPE:</b>
                      <code><span title="langgraph_sdk.schema.Input">Input</span> | None</code>

                    <b>DEFAULT:</b>
                      <code>None</code>
                  </span>
              </p>
            </td>
          </tr>
          <tr class="doc-section-item">
            <td>
                <code>command</code>
            </td>
            <td class="doc-param-details">
              <div class="doc-md-description">

              </div>

                    <b>TYPE:</b>

                      <code>None</code>
                  </span>
              </p>

If true, the stream can be resumed and replayed in its entirety even after disconnection.</p>

              </div>
              <p>
                  <span class="doc-param-annotation">
                    <b>TYPE:</b>
                      <code><a class="autorefs autorefs-internal" title="&lt;code class=&quot;doc-symbol doc-symbol-heading doc-symbol-class&quot;&gt;&lt;/code&gt;            &lt;span class=&quot;doc doc-object-name doc-class-name&quot;&gt;Config&lt;/span&gt; (&lt;code&gt;langgraph_sdk.schema.Config&lt;/code&gt;)" href="#langgraph_sdk.schema.Config">Config</a> | None</code>

<div class="admonition version-added">
<p class="admonition-title">Added in version 0.6.0</p>
</div>
              </div>
              <p>
                  <span class="doc-param-annotation">
                    <b>TYPE:</b>
                      <code><span title="langgraph_sdk.schema.Context">Context</span> | None</code>

            </td>

not be received here.</p>

<h3 id="langgraph_sdk.client.SyncCronClient" class="doc doc-heading">

<a href="#langgraph_sdk.client.SyncCronClient" class="headerlink" title="Copy anchor link to this section for reference">&para;</a></h3>


    <div class="doc doc-contents ">



        <p>Synchronous client for managing cron jobs in LangGraph.</p>
<p>This class provides methods to create and manage scheduled tasks (cron jobs) for automated graph executions.</p>
<details class="example" open="open">
<summary>Example</summary>
<div class="language-python highlight"><pre><span></span><code><span id="__span-0-1"><a id="__codelineno-0-1" name="__codelineno-0-1" href="#__codelineno-0-1"></a><span class="n">client</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">get_sync_client</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">url</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s2">&quot;http://localhost:8123&quot;</span><span class="p">)</span>
</span><span id="__span-0-2"><a id="__codelineno-0-2" name="__codelineno-0-2" href="#__codelineno-0-2"></a><span class="n">cron_job</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">client</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">crons</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">create_for_thread</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">thread_id</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s2">&quot;thread_123&quot;</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">assistant_id</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s2">&quot;asst_456&quot;</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">schedule</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s2">&quot;0 * * * *&quot;</span><span class="p">)</span>
</span></code></pre></div>
</details>

<p class="admonition-title">Feature Availability</p>
<p>The crons client functionality is not supported on all licenses.
Please check the relevant license documentation for the most up-to-date
details on feature availability.</p>

    <div class="doc doc-contents ">

        <p>Create a cron run.</p>


<table>
      <thead>
        <tr>
          <th><span class="doc-section-title">PARAMETER</span></th>
          <th><span>DESCRIPTION</span></th>
        </tr>
      </thead>
      <tbody>
          <tr class="doc-section-item">
            <td>
                <code>assistant_id</code>
            </td>
            <td class="doc-param-details">
              <div class="doc-md-description">
                <p>The assistant ID or graph name to use for the cron job.
If using graph name, will default to first assistant created from that graph.</p>
              </div>
              <p>
                  <span class="doc-param-annotation">
                    <b>TYPE:</b>
                      <code><a class="autorefs autorefs-external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str" target="_blank" rel="noopener">str</a></code>
                  </span>
              </p>
            </td>
          </tr>
          <tr class="doc-section-item">
            <td>
                <code>schedule</code>
            </td>
            <td class="doc-param-details">
              <div class="doc-md-description">
                <p>The cron schedule to execute this job on.
Schedules are interpreted in UTC.</p>
              </div>
              <p>
                  <span class="doc-param-annotation">
                    <b>TYPE:</b>
                      <code><a class="autorefs autorefs-external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str" target="_blank" rel="noopener">str</a></code>
                  </span>
              </p>
            </td>
          </tr>
          <tr class="doc-section-item">
            <td>
                <code>input</code>
            </td>
            <td class="doc-param-details">
              <div class="doc-md-description">
                <p>The input to the graph.</p>
              </div>
              <p>
                  <span class="doc-param-annotation">
                    <b>TYPE:</b>
                      <code><span title="langgraph_sdk.schema.Input">Input</span> | None</code>
                  </span>
                  <span class="doc-param-default">
                    <b>DEFAULT:</b>
                      <code>None</code>
                  </span>
              </p>
            </td>
          </tr>
          <tr class="doc-section-item">
            <td>
                <code>metadata</code>
            </td>
            <td class="doc-param-details">
              <div class="doc-md-description">
                <p>Metadata to assign to the cron job runs.</p>
              </div>
              <p>
                  <span class="doc-param-annotation">
                    <b>TYPE:</b>
                      <code><a class="autorefs autorefs-external" title="&lt;code&gt;collections.abc.Mapping&lt;/code&gt;" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/collections.abc.html#collections.abc.Mapping" target="_blank" rel="noopener">Mapping</a>[<a class="autorefs autorefs-external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str" target="_blank" rel="noopener">str</a>, <a class="autorefs autorefs-external" title="&lt;code&gt;typing.Any&lt;/code&gt;" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/typing.html#typing.Any" target="_blank" rel="noopener">Any</a>] | None</code>
                  </span>
                  <span class="doc-param-default">
                    <b>DEFAULT:</b>
                      <code>None</code>
                  </span>
              </p>
            </td>
          </tr>
          <tr class="doc-section-item">
            <td>
                <code>config</code>
            </td>
            <td class="doc-param-details">
              <div class="doc-md-description">
                <p>The configuration for the assistant.</p>
              </div>
              <p>
                  <span class="doc-param-annotation">
                    <b>TYPE:</b>
                      <code><a class="autorefs autorefs-internal" title="&lt;code class=&quot;doc-symbol doc-symbol-heading doc-symbol-class&quot;&gt;&lt;/code&gt;            &lt;span class=&quot;doc doc-object-name doc-class-name&quot;&gt;Config&lt;/span&gt; (&lt;code&gt;langgraph_sdk.schema.Config&lt;/code&gt;)" href="#langgraph_sdk.schema.Config">Config</a> | None</code>
                  </span>
                  <span class="doc-param-default">
                    <b>DEFAULT:</b>
                      <code>None</code>
                  </span>
              </p>
            </td>
          </tr>
          <tr class="doc-section-item">
            <td>
                <code>context</code>
            </td>
            <td class="doc-param-details">
              <div class="doc-md-description">
                <p>Static context to add to the assistant.</p>
<div class="admonition version-added">
<p class="admonition-title">Added in version 0.6.0</p>
</div>
              </div>
              <p>
                  <span class="doc-param-annotation">
                    <b>TYPE:</b>
                      <code><span title="langgraph_sdk.schema.Context">Context</span> | None</code>
                  </span>
                  <span class="doc-param-default">
                    <b>DEFAULT:</b>
                      <code>None</code>
                  </span>
              </p>
            </td>
          </tr>
          <tr class="doc-section-item">
            <td>
                <code>checkpoint_during</code>
            </td>
            <td class="doc-param-details">
              <div class="doc-md-description">
                <p>Whether to checkpoint during the run (or only at the end/interruption).</p>
              </div>
              <p>
                  <span class="doc-param-annotation">
                    <b>TYPE:</b>
                      <code><a class="autorefs autorefs-external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html#bool" target="_blank" rel="noopener">bool</a> | None</code>
                  </span>
                  <span class="doc-param-default">
                    <b>DEFAULT:</b>
                      <code>None</code>
                  </span>
              </p>
            </td>
          </tr>
          <tr class="doc-section-item">
            <td>
                <code>interrupt_before</code>
            </td>
            <td class="doc-param-details">
              <div class="doc-md-description">
                <p>Nodes to interrupt immediately before they get executed.</p>
              </div>
              <p>
                  <span class="doc-param-annotation">
                    <b>TYPE:</b>
                      <code><a class="autorefs autorefs-internal" title="&lt;code class=&quot;doc-symbol doc-symbol-heading doc-symbol-attribute&quot;&gt;&lt;/code&gt;            &lt;span class=&quot;doc doc-object-name doc-attribute-name&quot;&gt;All&lt;/span&gt;


  &lt;span class=&quot;doc doc-labels&quot;&gt;
      &lt;small class=&quot;doc doc-label doc-label-module-attribute&quot;&gt;&lt;code&gt;module-attribute&lt;/code&gt;&lt;/small&gt;
  &lt;/span&gt; (&lt;code&gt;langgraph_sdk.schema.All&lt;/code&gt;)" href="#langgraph_sdk.schema.All">All</a> | <a class="autorefs autorefs-external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#list" target="_blank" rel="noopener">list</a>[<a class="autorefs autorefs-external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str" target="_blank" rel="noopener">str</a>] | None</code>
                  </span>
                  <span class="doc-param-default">
                    <b>DEFAULT:</b>
                      <code>None</code>
                  </span>
              </p>
            </td>
          </tr>
          <tr class="doc-section-item">
            <td>
                <code>interrupt_after</code>
            </td>
            <td class="doc-param-details">
              <div class="doc-md-description">
                <p>Nodes to Nodes to interrupt immediately after they get executed.</p>
              </div>
              <p>
                  <span class="doc-param-annotation">
                    <b>TYPE:</b>
                      <code><a class="autorefs autorefs-internal" title="&lt;code class=&quot;doc-symbol doc-symbol-heading doc-symbol-attribute&quot;&gt;&lt;/code&gt;            &lt;span class=&quot;doc doc-object-name doc-attribute-name&quot;&gt;All&lt;/span&gt;


  &lt;span class=&quot;doc doc-labels&quot;&gt;
      &lt;small class=&quot;doc doc-label doc-label-module-attribute&quot;&gt;&lt;code&gt;module-attribute&lt;/code&gt;&lt;/small&gt;
  &lt;/span&gt; (&lt;code&gt;langgraph_sdk.schema.All&lt;/code&gt;)" href="#langgraph_sdk.schema.All">All</a> | <a class="autorefs autorefs-external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#list" target="_blank" rel="noopener">list</a>[<a class="autorefs autorefs-external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str" target="_blank" rel="noopener">str</a>] | None</code>
                  </span>
                  <span class="doc-param-default">
                    <b>DEFAULT:</b>
                      <code>None</code>
                  </span>
              </p>
            </td>
          </tr>
          <tr class="doc-section-item">
            <td>
                <code>webhook</code>
            </td>
            <td class="doc-param-details">
              <div class="doc-md-description">
                <p>Webhook to call after LangGraph API call is done.</p>
              </div>
              <p>
                  <span class="doc-param-annotation">
                    <b>TYPE:</b>
                      <code><a class="autorefs autorefs-external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str" target="_blank" rel="noopener">str</a> | None</code>
                  </span>
                  <span class="doc-param-default">
                    <b>DEFAULT:</b>
                      <code>None</code>
                  </span>
              </p>
            </td>
          </tr>
          <tr class="doc-section-item">
            <td>
                <code>on_run_completed</code>
            </td>
            <td class="doc-param-details">
              <div class="doc-md-description">
                <p>What to do with the thread after the run completes.
Must be one of 'delete' (default) or 'keep'. 'delete' removes the thread
after execution. 'keep' creates a new thread for each execution but does not
clean them up. Clients are responsible for cleaning up kept threads.</p>
              </div>
              <p>
                  <span class="doc-param-annotation">
                    <b>TYPE:</b>
                      <code><a class="autorefs autorefs-internal" title="&lt;code class=&quot;doc-symbol doc-symbol-heading doc-symbol-attribute&quot;&gt;&lt;/code&gt;            &lt;span class=&quot;doc doc-object-name doc-attribute-name&quot;&gt;OnCompletionBehavior&lt;/span&gt;


  &lt;span class=&quot;doc doc-labels&quot;&gt;
      &lt;small class=&quot;doc doc-label doc-label-module-attribute&quot;&gt;&lt;code&gt;module-attribute&lt;/code&gt;&lt;/small&gt;
  &lt;/span&gt; (&lt;code&gt;langgraph_sdk.schema.OnCompletionBehavior&lt;/code&gt;)" href="#langgraph_sdk.schema.OnCompletionBehavior">OnCompletionBehavior</a> | None</code>
                  </span>
                  <span class="doc-param-default">
                    <b>DEFAULT:</b>
                      <code>None</code>
                  </span>
              </p>
            </td>
          </tr>
          <tr class="doc-section-item">
            <td>
                <code>multitask_strategy</code>
            </td>
            <td class="doc-param-details">
              <div class="doc-md-description">
                <p>Multitask strategy to use.
Must be one of 'reject', 'interrupt', 'rollback', or 'enqueue'.</p>
              </div>
              <p>
                  <span class="doc-param-annotation">
                    <b>TYPE:</b>
                      <code><a class="autorefs autorefs-external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str" target="_blank" rel="noopener">str</a> | None</code>
                  </span>
                  <span class="doc-param-default">
                    <b>DEFAULT:</b>
                      <code>None</code>
                  </span>
              </p>
            </td>
          </tr>
          <tr class="doc-section-item">
            <td>
                <code>end_time</code>
            </td>
            <td class="doc-param-details">
              <div class="doc-md-description">
                <p>The time to stop running the cron job. If not provided, the cron job will run indefinitely.</p>
              </div>
              <p>
                  <span class="doc-param-annotation">
                    <b>TYPE:</b>
                      <code><a class="autorefs autorefs-external" title="&lt;code&gt;datetime.datetime&lt;/code&gt;" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/datetime.html#datetime.datetime" target="_blank" rel="noopener">datetime</a> | None</code>
                  </span>
                  <span class="doc-param-default">
                    <b>DEFAULT:</b>
                      <code>None</code>
                  </span>
              </p>
            </td>
          </tr>
          <tr class="doc-section-item">
            <td>
                <code>headers</code>
            </td>
            <td class="doc-param-details">
              <div class="doc-md-description">
                <p>Optional custom headers to include with the request.</p>
              </div>
              <p>

    <div class="doc doc-contents ">

        <p>Create and configure a LangGraphClient.</p>
<p>The client provides programmatic access to LangSmith Deployment. It supports
both remote servers and local in-process connections (when running inside a LangGraph server).</p>


<table>
      <thead>
        <tr>
          <th><span class="doc-section-title">PARAMETER</span></th>
          <th><span>DESCRIPTION</span></th>
        </tr>
      </thead>
      <tbody>
          <tr class="doc-section-item">
            <td>
                <code>url</code>
            </td>
            <td class="doc-param-details">
              <div class="doc-md-description">
                <p>Base URL of the LangGraph API.
- If <code>None</code>, the client first attempts an in-process connection via ASGI transport.
  If that fails, it defers registration until after app initialization. This
  only works if the client is used from within the Agent server.</p>
              </div>
              <p>
                  <span class="doc-param-annotation">
                    <b>TYPE:</b>
                      <code><a class="autorefs autorefs-external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str" target="_blank" rel="noopener">str</a> | None</code>
                  </span>
                  <span class="doc-param-default">
                    <b>DEFAULT:</b>
                      <code>None</code>
                  </span>
              </p>
            </td>
          </tr>
          <tr class="doc-section-item">
            <td>
                <code>api_key</code>
            </td>
            <td class="doc-param-details">
              <div class="doc-md-description">
                <p>API key for authentication. Can be:
  - A string: use this exact API key
  - <code>None</code>: explicitly skip loading from environment variables
  - Not provided (default): auto-load from environment in this order:
    1. <code>LANGGRAPH_API_KEY</code>
    2. <code>LANGSMITH_API_KEY</code>
    3. <code>LANGCHAIN_API_KEY</code></p>
              </div>
              <p>
                  <span class="doc-param-annotation">
                    <b>TYPE:</b>
                      <code><a class="autorefs autorefs-external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str" target="_blank" rel="noopener">str</a> | None</code>
                  </span>
                  <span class="doc-param-default">
                    <b>DEFAULT:</b>
                      <code><span title="langgraph_sdk.client.NOT_PROVIDED">NOT_PROVIDED</span></code>
                  </span>
              </p>
            </td>
          </tr>
          <tr class="doc-section-item">
            <td>
                <code>headers</code>
            </td>
            <td class="doc-param-details">
              <div class="doc-md-description">
                <p>Additional HTTP headers to include in requests. Merged with authentication headers.</p>
              </div>
              <p>
                  <span class="doc-param-annotation">
                    <b>TYPE:</b>
                      <code><a class="autorefs autorefs-external" title="&lt;code&gt;collections.abc.Mapping&lt;/code&gt;" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/collections.abc.html#collections.abc.Mapping" target="_blank" rel="noopener">Mapping</a>[<a class="autorefs autorefs-external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str" target="_blank" rel="noopener">str</a>, <a class="autorefs autorefs-external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str" target="_blank" rel="noopener">str</a>] | None</code>
                  </span>
                  <span class="doc-param-default">
                    <b>DEFAULT:</b>
                      <code>None</code>
                  </span>
              </p>
            </td>
          </tr>
          <tr class="doc-section-item">
            <td>
                <code>timeout</code>
            </td>
            <td class="doc-param-details">
              <div class="doc-md-description">
                <p>HTTP timeout configuration. May be:
  - <code>httpx.Timeout</code> instance
  - float (total seconds)
  - tuple <code>(connect, read, write, pool)</code> in seconds
Defaults: connect=5, read=300, write=300, pool=5.</p>
              </div>
              <p>
                  <span class="doc-param-annotation">
                    <b>TYPE:</b>
                      <code><span title="langgraph_sdk.client.TimeoutTypes">TimeoutTypes</span> | None</code>
                  </span>
                  <span class="doc-param-default">
                    <b>DEFAULT:</b>
                      <code>None</code>
                  </span>
              </p>
            </td>
          </tr>
      </tbody>

</span></code></pre></div>

    <div class="doc doc-contents ">

        <p>Represents the status of a run:
- "pending": The run is waiting to start.
- "running": The run is currently executing.
- "error": The run encountered an error and stopped.
- "success": The run completed successfully.
- "timeout": The run exceeded its time limit.
- "interrupted": The run was manually stopped or interrupted.</p>

</span></code></pre></div>

        <p>Represents the status of a thread:
- "idle": The thread is not currently processing any task.
- "busy": The thread is actively processing a task.
- "interrupted": The thread's execution was interrupted.
- "error": An exception occurred during task processing.</p>

<h2 id="langgraph_sdk.auth" class="doc doc-heading">
<code class="doc-symbol doc-symbol-heading doc-symbol-module"></code>            <span class="doc doc-object-name doc-module-name">auth</span>


<a href="#langgraph_sdk.auth" class="headerlink" title="Copy anchor link to this section for reference">&para;</a></h2>

    <div class="doc doc-contents first">

          










  <div class="doc doc-children">









<div class="doc doc-object doc-class">



<h3 id="langgraph_sdk.auth.Auth" class="doc doc-heading">
<code class="doc-symbol doc-symbol-heading doc-symbol-class"></code>            <span class="doc doc-object-name doc-class-name">Auth</span>


<a href="#langgraph_sdk.auth.Auth" class="headerlink" title="Copy anchor link to this section for reference">&para;</a></h3>


    <div class="doc doc-contents ">



        <p>Add custom authentication and authorization management to your LangGraph application.</p>
<p>The Auth class provides a unified system for handling authentication and
authorization in LangGraph applications. It supports custom user authentication
protocols and fine-grained authorization rules for different resources and
actions.</p>
<p>To use, create a separate python file and add the path to the file to your
LangGraph API configuration file (<code>langgraph.json</code>). Within that file, create
an instance of the Auth class and register authentication and authorization
handlers as needed.</p>
<p>Example <code>langgraph.json</code> file:</p>
<div class="language-json highlight"><pre><span></span><code><span id="__span-0-1"><a id="__codelineno-0-1" name="__codelineno-0-1" href="#__codelineno-0-1"></a><span class="p">{</span>
</span><span id="__span-0-2"><a id="__codelineno-0-2" name="__codelineno-0-2" href="#__codelineno-0-2"></a><span class="w">  </span><span class="nt">&quot;dependencies&quot;</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s2">&quot;.&quot;</span><span class="p">],</span>
</span><span id="__span-0-3"><a id="__codelineno-0-3" name="__codelineno-0-3" href="#__codelineno-0-3"></a><span class="w">  </span><span class="nt">&quot;graphs&quot;</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="p">{</span>
</span><span id="__span-0-4"><a id="__codelineno-0-4" name="__codelineno-0-4" href="#__codelineno-0-4"></a><span class="w">    </span><span class="nt">&quot;agent&quot;</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="s2">&quot;./my_agent/agent.py:graph&quot;</span>
</span><span id="__span-0-5"><a id="__codelineno-0-5" name="__codelineno-0-5" href="#__codelineno-0-5"></a><span class="w">  </span><span class="p">},</span>
</span><span id="__span-0-6"><a id="__codelineno-0-6" name="__codelineno-0-6" href="#__codelineno-0-6"></a><span class="w">  </span><span class="nt">&quot;env&quot;</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="s2">&quot;.env&quot;</span><span class="p">,</span>
</span><span id="__span-0-7"><a id="__codelineno-0-7" name="__codelineno-0-7" href="#__codelineno-0-7"></a><span class="w">  </span><span class="nt">&quot;auth&quot;</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="p">{</span>
</span><span id="__span-0-8"><a id="__codelineno-0-8" name="__codelineno-0-8" href="#__codelineno-0-8"></a><span class="w">    </span><span class="nt">&quot;path&quot;</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="s2">&quot;./auth.py:my_auth&quot;</span>
</span><span id="__span-0-9"><a id="__codelineno-0-9" name="__codelineno-0-9" href="#__codelineno-0-9"></a><span class="w">  </span><span class="p">}</span>
</span></code></pre></div>
<p>Then the LangGraph server will load your auth file and run it server-side whenever a request comes in.</p>
<details class="example" open="open">
<summary>Basic Usage</summary>
<div class="language-python highlight"><pre><span></span><code><span id="__span-1-1"><a id="__codelineno-1-1" name="__codelineno-1-1" href="#__codelineno-1-1"></a><span class="kn">from</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="nn">langgraph_sdk</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="kn">import</span> <span class="n">Auth</span>
</span><span id="__span-1-2"><a id="__codelineno-1-2" name="__codelineno-1-2" href="#__codelineno-1-2"></a>
</span><span id="__span-1-3"><a id="__codelineno-1-3" name="__codelineno-1-3" href="#__codelineno-1-3"></a><span class="n">my_auth</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">Auth</span><span class="p">()</span>
</span><span id="__span-1-4"><a id="__codelineno-1-4" name="__codelineno-1-4" href="#__codelineno-1-4"></a>
</span><span id="__span-1-5"><a id="__codelineno-1-5" name="__codelineno-1-5" href="#__codelineno-1-5"></a><span class="k">async</span> <span class="k">def</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="nf">verify_token</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">token</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="nb">str</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="o">-&gt;</span> <span class="nb">str</span><span class="p">:</span>
</span><span id="__span-1-6"><a id="__codelineno-1-6" name="__codelineno-1-6" href="#__codelineno-1-6"></a>    <span class="c1"># Verify token and return user_id</span>
</span><span id="__span-1-7"><a id="__codelineno-1-7" name="__codelineno-1-7" href="#__codelineno-1-7"></a>    <span class="c1"># This would typically be a call to your auth server</span>
</span><span id="__span-1-8"><a id="__codelineno-1-8" name="__codelineno-1-8" href="#__codelineno-1-8"></a>    <span class="k">return</span> <span class="s2">&quot;user_id&quot;</span>
</span><span id="__span-1-9"><a id="__codelineno-1-9" name="__codelineno-1-9" href="#__codelineno-1-9"></a>
</span><span id="__span-1-10"><a id="__codelineno-1-10" name="__codelineno-1-10" href="#__codelineno-1-10"></a><span class="nd">@auth</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">authenticate</span>
</span><span id="__span-1-11"><a id="__codelineno-1-11" name="__codelineno-1-11" href="#__codelineno-1-11"></a><span class="k">async</span> <span class="k">def</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="nf">authenticate</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">authorization</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="nb">str</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="o">-&gt;</span> <span class="nb">str</span><span class="p">:</span>
</span><span id="__span-1-12"><a id="__codelineno-1-12" name="__codelineno-1-12" href="#__codelineno-1-12"></a>    <span class="c1"># Verify token and return user_id</span>
</span><span id="__span-1-13"><a id="__codelineno-1-13" name="__codelineno-1-13" href="#__codelineno-1-13"></a>    <span class="n">result</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="k">await</span> <span class="n">verify_token</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">authorization</span><span class="p">)</span>
</span><span id="__span-1-14"><a id="__codelineno-1-14" name="__codelineno-1-14" href="#__codelineno-1-14"></a>    <span class="k">if</span> <span class="n">result</span> <span class="o">!=</span> <span class="s2">&quot;user_id&quot;</span><span class="p">:</span>
</span><span id="__span-1-15"><a id="__codelineno-1-15" name="__codelineno-1-15" href="#__codelineno-1-15"></a>        <span class="k">raise</span> <span class="n">Auth</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">exceptions</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">HTTPException</span><span class="p">(</span>
</span><span id="__span-1-16"><a id="__codelineno-1-16" name="__codelineno-1-16" href="#__codelineno-1-16"></a>            <span class="n">status_code</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="mi">401</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">detail</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s2">&quot;Unauthorized&quot;</span>
</span><span id="__span-1-17"><a id="__codelineno-1-17" name="__codelineno-1-17" href="#__codelineno-1-17"></a>        <span class="p">)</span>
</span><span id="__span-1-18"><a id="__codelineno-1-18" name="__codelineno-1-18" href="#__codelineno-1-18"></a>    <span class="k">return</span> <span class="n">result</span>
</span><span id="__span-1-19"><a id="__codelineno-1-19" name="__codelineno-1-19" href="#__codelineno-1-19"></a>
</span><span id="__span-1-20"><a id="__codelineno-1-20" name="__codelineno-1-20" href="#__codelineno-1-20"></a><span class="c1"># Global fallback handler</span>
</span><span id="__span-1-21"><a id="__codelineno-1-21" name="__codelineno-1-21" href="#__codelineno-1-21"></a><span class="nd">@auth</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">on</span>
</span><span id="__span-1-22"><a id="__codelineno-1-22" name="__codelineno-1-22" href="#__codelineno-1-22"></a><span class="k">async</span> <span class="k">def</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="nf">authorize_default</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">params</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="n">Auth</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">on</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">value</span><span class="p">):</span>
</span><span id="__span-1-23"><a id="__codelineno-1-23" name="__codelineno-1-23" href="#__codelineno-1-23"></a>    <span class="k">return</span> <span class="kc">False</span> <span class="c1"># Reject all requests (default behavior)</span>
</span><span id="__span-1-24"><a id="__codelineno-1-24" name="__codelineno-1-24" href="#__codelineno-1-24"></a>
</span><span id="__span-1-25"><a id="__codelineno-1-25" name="__codelineno-1-25" href="#__codelineno-1-25"></a><span class="nd">@auth</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">on</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">threads</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">create</span>
</span><span id="__span-1-26"><a id="__codelineno-1-26" name="__codelineno-1-26" href="#__codelineno-1-26"></a><span class="k">async</span> <span class="k">def</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="nf">authorize_thread_create</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">params</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="n">Auth</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">on</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">threads</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">create</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">value</span><span class="p">):</span>
</span><span id="__span-1-27"><a id="__codelineno-1-27" name="__codelineno-1-27" href="#__codelineno-1-27"></a>    <span class="c1"># Allow the allowed user to create a thread</span>
</span><span id="__span-1-28"><a id="__codelineno-1-28" name="__codelineno-1-28" href="#__codelineno-1-28"></a>    <span class="k">assert</span> <span class="n">params</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">get</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">&quot;metadata&quot;</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="p">{})</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">get</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">&quot;owner&quot;</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="o">==</span> <span class="s2">&quot;allowed_user&quot;</span>
</span><span id="__span-1-29"><a id="__codelineno-1-29" name="__codelineno-1-29" href="#__codelineno-1-29"></a>
</span><span id="__span-1-30"><a id="__codelineno-1-30" name="__codelineno-1-30" href="#__codelineno-1-30"></a><span class="nd">@auth</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">on</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">store</span>
</span><span id="__span-1-31"><a id="__codelineno-1-31" name="__codelineno-1-31" href="#__codelineno-1-31"></a><span class="k">async</span> <span class="k">def</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="nf">authorize_store</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">ctx</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="n">Auth</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">types</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">AuthContext</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">value</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="n">Auth</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">types</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">on</span><span class="p">):</span>
</span><span id="__span-1-32"><a id="__codelineno-1-32" name="__codelineno-1-32" href="#__codelineno-1-32"></a>    <span class="k">assert</span> <span class="n">ctx</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">user</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">identity</span> <span class="ow">in</span> <span class="n">value</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s2">&quot;namespace&quot;</span><span class="p">],</span> <span class="s2">&quot;Not authorized&quot;</span>
</span></code></pre></div>
</details>
<details class="note" open="open">
<summary>Request Processing Flow</summary>
<ol>
<li>Authentication (your <code>@auth.authenticate</code> handler) is performed first on <strong>every request</strong></li>
<li>For authorization, the most specific matching handler is called:<ul>
<li>If a handler exists for the exact resource and action, it is used (e.g., <code>@auth.on.threads.create</code>)</li>
<li>Otherwise, if a handler exists for the resource with any action, it is used (e.g., <code>@auth.on.threads</code>)</li>
<li>Finally, if no specific handlers match, the global handler is used (e.g., <code>@auth.on</code>)</li>
<li>If no global handler is set, the request is accepted</li>
</ul>
</li>
</ol>
<p>This allows you to set default behavior with a global handler while
overriding specific routes as needed.</p>
</details>

<h4 id="langgraph_sdk.auth.Auth.on" class="doc doc-heading">
<code class="doc-symbol doc-symbol-heading doc-symbol-attribute"></code>            <span class="doc doc-object-name doc-attribute-name">on</span>


  <span class="doc doc-labels">
      <small class="doc doc-label doc-label-instance-attribute"><code>instance-attribute</code></small>
  </span>

<a href="#langgraph_sdk.auth.Auth.on" class="headerlink" title="Copy anchor link to this section for reference">&para;</a></h4>
<div class="language-python doc-signature highlight"><pre><span></span><code><span id="__span-0-1"><a id="__codelineno-0-1" name="__codelineno-0-1" href="#__codelineno-0-1"></a><span class="n">on</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n"><span title="langgraph_sdk.auth._On">_On</span></span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n"><span title="langgraph_sdk.auth.Auth(self)">self</span></span><span class="p">)</span>
</span></code></pre></div>

    <div class="doc doc-contents ">

        <p>Entry point for authorization handlers that control access to specific resources.</p>
<p>The on class provides a flexible way to define authorization rules for different
resources and actions in your application. It supports three main usage patterns:</p>
<ol>
<li>Global handlers that run for all resources and actions</li>
<li>Resource-specific handlers that run for all actions on a resource</li>
<li>Resource and action specific handlers for fine-grained control</li>
</ol>


<details class="each-handler-must-be-an-async-function-that-accepts-two-parameters" open>
  <summary>Each handler must be an async function that accepts two parameters</summary>
  <ul>
<li>ctx (AuthContext): Contains request context and authenticated user info</li>
<li>value: The data being authorized (type varies by endpoint)</li>
</ul>
</details>        <p>The handler should return one of:</p>
<div class="language-text highlight"><pre><span></span><code>- None or True: Accept the request
- False: Reject with 403 error
- FilterType: Apply filtering rules to the response
</code></pre></div>
<details class="example" open="open">
<summary>Examples</summary>
<p>Global handler for all requests:</p>
<div class="language-python highlight"><pre><span></span><code><span id="__span-0-1"><a id="__codelineno-0-1" name="__codelineno-0-1" href="#__codelineno-0-1"></a><span class="nd">@auth</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">on</span>
</span><span id="__span-0-2"><a id="__codelineno-0-2" name="__codelineno-0-2" href="#__codelineno-0-2"></a><span class="k">async</span> <span class="k">def</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="nf">reject_unhandled_requests</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">ctx</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="n">AuthContext</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">value</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="n">Any</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="o">-&gt;</span> <span class="kc">None</span><span class="p">:</span>
</span><span id="__span-0-3"><a id="__codelineno-0-3" name="__codelineno-0-3" href="#__codelineno-0-3"></a>    <span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="sa">f</span><span class="s2">&quot;Request to </span><span class="si">{</span><span class="n">ctx</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">path</span><span class="si">}</span><span class="s2"> by </span><span class="si">{</span><span class="n">ctx</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">user</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">identity</span><span class="si">}</span><span class="s2">&quot;</span><span class="p">)</span>
</span><span id="__span-0-4"><a id="__codelineno-0-4" name="__codelineno-0-4" href="#__codelineno-0-4"></a>    <span class="k">return</span> <span class="kc">False</span>
</span></code></pre></div>
<p>Resource-specific handler. This would take precedence over the global handler
for all actions on the <code>threads</code> resource:</p>
<div class="language-python highlight"><pre><span></span><code><span id="__span-1-1"><a id="__codelineno-1-1" name="__codelineno-1-1" href="#__codelineno-1-1"></a><span class="nd">@auth</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">on</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">threads</span>
</span><span id="__span-1-2"><a id="__codelineno-1-2" name="__codelineno-1-2" href="#__codelineno-1-2"></a><span class="k">async</span> <span class="k">def</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="nf">check_thread_access</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">ctx</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="n">AuthContext</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">value</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="n">Any</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="o">-&gt;</span> <span class="nb">bool</span><span class="p">:</span>
</span><span id="__span-1-3"><a id="__codelineno-1-3" name="__codelineno-1-3" href="#__codelineno-1-3"></a>    <span class="c1"># Allow access only to threads created by the user</span>
</span><span id="__span-1-4"><a id="__codelineno-1-4" name="__codelineno-1-4" href="#__codelineno-1-4"></a>    <span class="k">return</span> <span class="n">value</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">get</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">&quot;created_by&quot;</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="o">==</span> <span class="n">ctx</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">user</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">identity</span>
</span></code></pre></div>
<p>Resource and action specific handler:</p>
<div class="language-python highlight"><pre><span></span><code><span id="__span-2-1"><a id="__codelineno-2-1" name="__codelineno-2-1" href="#__codelineno-2-1"></a><span class="nd">@auth</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">on</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">threads</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">delete</span>
</span><span id="__span-2-2"><a id="__codelineno-2-2" name="__codelineno-2-2" href="#__codelineno-2-2"></a><span class="k">async</span> <span class="k">def</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="nf">prevent_thread_deletion</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">ctx</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="n">AuthContext</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">value</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="n">Any</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="o">-&gt;</span> <span class="nb">bool</span><span class="p">:</span>
</span><span id="__span-2-3"><a id="__codelineno-2-3" name="__codelineno-2-3" href="#__codelineno-2-3"></a>    <span class="c1"># Only admins can delete threads</span>
</span><span id="__span-2-4"><a id="__codelineno-2-4" name="__codelineno-2-4" href="#__codelineno-2-4"></a>    <span class="k">return</span> <span class="s2">&quot;admin&quot;</span> <span class="ow">in</span> <span class="n">ctx</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">user</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">permissions</span>
</span></code></pre></div>
<p>Multiple resources or actions:</p>
<div class="language-python highlight"><pre><span></span><code><span id="__span-3-1"><a id="__codelineno-3-1" name="__codelineno-3-1" href="#__codelineno-3-1"></a><span class="nd">@auth</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">on</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">resources</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s2">&quot;threads&quot;</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s2">&quot;runs&quot;</span><span class="p">],</span> <span class="n">actions</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s2">&quot;create&quot;</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s2">&quot;update&quot;</span><span class="p">])</span>
</span><span id="__span-3-2"><a id="__codelineno-3-2" name="__codelineno-3-2" href="#__codelineno-3-2"></a><span class="k">async</span> <span class="k">def</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="nf">rate_limit_writes</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">ctx</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="n">AuthContext</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">value</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="n">Any</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="o">-&gt;</span> <span class="nb">bool</span><span class="p">:</span>
</span><span id="__span-3-3"><a id="__codelineno-3-3" name="__codelineno-3-3" href="#__codelineno-3-3"></a>    <span class="c1"># Implement rate limiting for write operations</span>
</span><span id="__span-3-4"><a id="__codelineno-3-4" name="__codelineno-3-4" href="#__codelineno-3-4"></a>    <span class="k">return</span> <span class="k">await</span> <span class="n">check_rate_limit</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">ctx</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">user</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">identity</span><span class="p">)</span>
</span></code></pre></div>
<p>Auth for the <code>store</code> resource is a bit different since its structure is developer defined.
You typically want to enforce user creds in the namespace.</p>
<div class="language-python highlight"><pre><span></span><code><span id="__span-4-1"><a id="__codelineno-4-1" name="__codelineno-4-1" href="#__codelineno-4-1"></a><span class="nd">@auth</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">on</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">store</span>
</span><span id="__span-4-2"><a id="__codelineno-4-2" name="__codelineno-4-2" href="#__codelineno-4-2"></a><span class="k">async</span> <span class="k">def</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="nf">check_store_access</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">ctx</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="n">AuthContext</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">value</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="n">Auth</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">types</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">on</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="o">-&gt;</span> <span class="nb">bool</span><span class="p">:</span>
</span><span id="__span-4-3"><a id="__codelineno-4-3" name="__codelineno-4-3" href="#__codelineno-4-3"></a>    <span class="c1"># Assuming you structure your store like (store.aput((user_id, application_context), key, value))</span>
</span><span id="__span-4-4"><a id="__codelineno-4-4" name="__codelineno-4-4" href="#__codelineno-4-4"></a>    <span class="k">assert</span> <span class="n">value</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s2">&quot;namespace&quot;</span><span class="p">][</span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">==</span> <span class="n">ctx</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">user</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">identity</span>
</span></code></pre></div>
</details>

          
    </div>

</div>


  

<div class="doc doc-object doc-function">

<h4 id="langgraph_sdk.auth.Auth.authenticate" class="doc doc-heading">      
<code class="doc-symbol doc-symbol-heading doc-symbol-method"></code>            <span class="doc doc-object-name doc-function-name">authenticate</span>


<a href="#langgraph_sdk.auth.Auth.authenticate" class="headerlink" title="Copy anchor link to this section for reference">&para;</a></h4>
<div class="language-python doc-signature highlight"><pre><span></span><code><span id="__span-0-1"><a id="__codelineno-0-1" name="__codelineno-0-1" href="#__codelineno-0-1"></a><span class="nf">authenticate</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">fn</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="n"><span title="langgraph_sdk.auth.AH">AH</span></span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="o">-&gt;</span> <span class="n"><span title="langgraph_sdk.auth.AH">AH</span></span>
</span></code></pre></div>

    <div class="doc doc-contents ">

        <p>Register an authentication handler function.</p>
<p>The authentication handler is responsible for verifying credentials
and returning user scopes. It can accept any of the following parameters
by name:</p>
<div class="language-text highlight"><pre><span></span><code>- request (Request): The raw ASGI request object
- path (str): The request path, e.g., &quot;/threads/abcd-1234-abcd-1234/runs/abcd-1234-abcd-1234/stream&quot;
- method (str): The HTTP method, e.g., &quot;GET&quot;
- path_params (dict[str, str]): URL path parameters, e.g., {&quot;thread_id&quot;: &quot;abcd-1234-abcd-1234&quot;, &quot;run_id&quot;: &quot;abcd-1234-abcd-1234&quot;}
- query_params (dict[str, str]): URL query parameters, e.g., {&quot;stream&quot;: &quot;true&quot;}
- headers (dict[bytes, bytes]): Request headers
- authorization (str | None): The Authorization header value (e.g., &quot;Bearer &lt;token&gt;&quot;)
</code></pre></div>

      <thead>
        <tr>
          <th><span class="doc-section-title">PARAMETER</span></th>

                <code>fn</code>
            </td>
            <td class="doc-param-details">
              <div class="doc-md-description">
                <p>The authentication handler function to register.
Must return a representation of the user. This could be a:
    - string (the user id)
    - dict containing {"identity": str, "permissions": list[str]}
    - or an object with identity and permissions properties
Permissions can be optionally used by your handlers downstream.</p>

<p>Basic token authentication:</p>

</span><span id="__span-0-3"><a id="__codelineno-0-3" name="__codelineno-0-3" href="#__codelineno-0-3"></a>    <span class="n">user_id</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">verify_token</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">authorization</span><span class="p">)</span>

</span><span id="__span-1-2"><a id="__codelineno-1-2" name="__codelineno-1-2" href="#__codelineno-1-2"></a><span class="k">async</span> <span class="k">def</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="nf">authenticate</span><span class="p">(</span>
</span><span id="__span-1-3"><a id="__codelineno-1-3" name="__codelineno-1-3" href="#__codelineno-1-3"></a>    <span class="n">method</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="nb">str</span><span class="p">,</span>
</span><span id="__span-1-4"><a id="__codelineno-1-4" name="__codelineno-1-4" href="#__codelineno-1-4"></a>    <span class="n">path</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="nb">str</span><span class="p">,</span>
</span><span id="__span-1-5"><a id="__codelineno-1-5" name="__codelineno-1-5" href="#__codelineno-1-5"></a>    <span class="n">headers</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="nb">dict</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="nb">str</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="nb">bytes</span><span class="p">]</span>
</span><span id="__span-1-6"><a id="__codelineno-1-6" name="__codelineno-1-6" href="#__codelineno-1-6"></a><span class="p">)</span> <span class="o">-&gt;</span> <span class="nb">str</span><span class="p">:</span>

</span><span id="__span-2-7"><a id="__codelineno-2-7" name="__codelineno-2-7" href="#__codelineno-2-7"></a>    <span class="n">permissions</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">user</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="k">await</span> <span class="n">verify_request</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">method</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">path</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">headers</span><span class="p">)</span>

</span></code></pre></div>

    <div class="doc doc-contents ">

        <p>Strategy for handling multiple concurrent tasks.</p>


<details class="values" open>
  <summary>Values</summary>
  <ul>
<li>reject: Reject new tasks while one is in progress</li>
<li>rollback: Cancel current task and start new one</li>
<li>interrupt: Interrupt current task and start new one</li>
<li>enqueue: Queue new tasks to run after current one</li>
</ul>
</details>

</span><span id="__span-0-8"><a id="__codelineno-0-8" name="__codelineno-0-8" href="#__codelineno-0-8"></a>    <span class="o">|</span> <span class="n"><a class="autorefs autorefs-external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#dict" target="_blank" rel="noopener">dict</a></span><span class="p">[</span><span class="n"><a class="autorefs autorefs-external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str" target="_blank" rel="noopener">str</a></span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n"><a class="autorefs autorefs-external" href="https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str" target="_blank" rel="noopener">str</a></span><span class="p">]</span>
</span><span id="__span-0-9"><a id="__codelineno-0-9" name="__codelineno-0-9" href="#__codelineno-0-9"></a><span class="p">)</span>
</span></code></pre></div>

    <div class="doc doc-contents ">

        <p>Response type for authorization handlers.</p>


<details class="supports-exact-matches-and-operators" open>
  <summary>Supports exact matches and operators</summary>
  <ul>
<li>Exact match shorthand: {"field": "value"}</li>
<li>Exact match: {"field": {"$eq": "value"}}</li>
<li>Contains (membership): {"field": {"$contains": "value"}}</li>
<li>Contains (subset containment): {"field": {"$contains": ["value1", "value2"]}}</li>
</ul>
</details>        <p>Subset containment is only supported by newer versions of the LangGraph dev server;
install langgraph-runtime-inmem &gt;= 0.14.1 to use this filter variant.</p>
<details class="example" open="open">
<summary>Examples</summary>
<p>Simple exact match filter for the resource owner:</p>
<div class="language-python highlight"><pre><span></span><code><span id="__span-0-1"><a id="__codelineno-0-1" name="__codelineno-0-1" href="#__codelineno-0-1"></a><span class="nb">filter</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">{</span><span class="s2">&quot;owner&quot;</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="s2">&quot;user-abcd123&quot;</span><span class="p">}</span>
</span></code></pre></div>
<p>Explicit version of the exact match filter:</p>
<div class="language-python highlight"><pre><span></span><code><span id="__span-1-1"><a id="__codelineno-1-1" name="__codelineno-1-1" href="#__codelineno-1-1"></a><span class="nb">filter</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">{</span><span class="s2">&quot;owner&quot;</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="p">{</span><span class="s2">&quot;$eq&quot;</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="s2">&quot;user-abcd123&quot;</span><span class="p">}}</span>
</span></code></pre></div>
<p>Containment (membership of a single element):</p>
<div class="language-python highlight"><pre><span></span><code><span id="__span-2-1"><a id="__codelineno-2-1" name="__codelineno-2-1" href="#__codelineno-2-1"></a><span class="nb">filter</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">{</span><span class="s2">&quot;participants&quot;</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="p">{</span><span class="s2">&quot;$contains&quot;</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="s2">&quot;user-abcd123&quot;</span><span class="p">}}</span>
</span></code></pre></div>
<p>Containment (subset containment; all values must be present, but order doesn't matter):</p>
<div class="language-python highlight"><pre><span></span><code><span id="__span-3-1"><a id="__codelineno-3-1" name="__codelineno-3-1" href="#__codelineno-3-1"></a><span class="nb">filter</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">{</span><span class="s2">&quot;participants&quot;</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="p">{</span><span class="s2">&quot;$contains&quot;</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="p">[</span><span class="s2">&quot;user-abcd123&quot;</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s2">&quot;user-efgh456&quot;</span><span class="p">]}}</span>
</span></code></pre></div>
<p>Combining filters (treated as a logical <code>AND</code>):</p>
<div class="language-python highlight"><pre><span></span><code><span id="__span-4-1"><a id="__codelineno-4-1" name="__codelineno-4-1" href="#__codelineno-4-1"></a><span class="nb">filter</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">{</span><span class="s2">&quot;owner&quot;</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="s2">&quot;user-abcd123&quot;</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s2">&quot;participants&quot;</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="p">{</span><span class="s2">&quot;$contains&quot;</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="s2">&quot;user-efgh456&quot;</span><span class="p">}}</span>
</span></code></pre></div>
</details>

          
    </div>

</div>

</span><span id="__span-0-2"><a id="__codelineno-0-2" name="__codelineno-0-2" href="#__codelineno-0-2"></a>    <span class="s2">&quot;created_by&quot;</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="s2">&quot;user123&quot;</span><span class="p">,</span>

    <div class="doc doc-contents ">

        <p>Type for authentication functions.</p>
<p>An authenticator can return either:
1. A string (user_id)
2. A dict containing {"identity": str, "permissions": list[str]}
3. An object with identity and permissions properties</p>
<p>Permissions can be used downstream by your authorization logic to determine
access permissions to different resources.</p>
<p>The authenticate decorator will automatically inject any of the following parameters
by name if they are included in your function signature:</p>


<table>
      <thead>
        <tr>
          <th><span class="doc-section-title">PARAMETER</span></th>

        </tr>
      </thead>
      <tbody>
          <tr class="doc-section-item">

        <details class="example" open="open">
<summary>Examples</summary>
<p>Basic authentication with token:</p>
<div class="language-python highlight"><pre><span></span><code><span id="__span-0-1"><a id="__codelineno-0-1" name="__codelineno-0-1" href="#__codelineno-0-1"></a><span class="kn">from</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="nn">langgraph_sdk</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="kn">import</span> <span class="n">Auth</span>
</span><span id="__span-0-2"><a id="__codelineno-0-2" name="__codelineno-0-2" href="#__codelineno-0-2"></a>
</span><span id="__span-0-3"><a id="__codelineno-0-3" name="__codelineno-0-3" href="#__codelineno-0-3"></a><span class="n">auth</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">Auth</span><span class="p">()</span>

<h3 id="langgraph_sdk.auth.types.StudioUser" class="doc doc-heading">

    <div class="doc doc-contents ">



        <p>A user object that's populated from authenticated requests from the LangGraph studio.</p>
<p>Note: Studio auth can be disabled in your <code>langgraph.json</code> config.</p>
<div class="language-json highlight"><pre><span></span><code><span id="__span-0-1"><a id="__codelineno-0-1" name="__codelineno-0-1" href="#__codelineno-0-1"></a><span class="p">{</span>
</span><span id="__span-0-2"><a id="__codelineno-0-2" name="__codelineno-0-2" href="#__codelineno-0-2"></a><span class="w">  </span><span class="nt">&quot;auth&quot;</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="p">{</span>
</span><span id="__span-0-3"><a id="__codelineno-0-3" name="__codelineno-0-3" href="#__codelineno-0-3"></a><span class="w">    </span><span class="nt">&quot;disable_studio_auth&quot;</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="kc">true</span>
</span><span id="__span-0-4"><a id="__codelineno-0-4" name="__codelineno-0-4" href="#__codelineno-0-4"></a><span class="w">  </span><span class="p">}</span>
</span><span id="__span-0-5"><a id="__codelineno-0-5" name="__codelineno-0-5" href="#__codelineno-0-5"></a><span class="p">}</span>
</span></code></pre></div>
<p>You can use <code>isinstance</code> checks in your authorization handlers (<code>@auth.on</code>) to control access specifically
for developers accessing the instance from the LangGraph Studio UI.</p>
<details class="example" open="open">
<summary>Examples</summary>
<div class="language-python highlight"><pre><span></span><code><span id="__span-1-1"><a id="__codelineno-1-1" name="__codelineno-1-1" href="#__codelineno-1-1"></a><span class="nd">@auth</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">on</span>
</span><span id="__span-1-2"><a id="__codelineno-1-2" name="__codelineno-1-2" href="#__codelineno-1-2"></a><span class="k">async</span> <span class="k">def</span><span class="w"> </span><span class="nf">allow_developers</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">ctx</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="n">Auth</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">types</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">AuthContext</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">value</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="n">Any</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="o">-&gt;</span> <span class="kc">None</span><span class="p">:</span>
</span><span id="__span-1-3"><a id="__codelineno-1-3" name="__codelineno-1-3" href="#__codelineno-1-3"></a>    <span class="k">if</span> <span class="nb">isinstance</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">ctx</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">user</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">Auth</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">types</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">StudioUser</span><span class="p">):</span>
</span><span id="__span-1-4"><a id="__codelineno-1-4" name="__codelineno-1-4" href="#__codelineno-1-4"></a>        <span class="k">return</span> <span class="kc">None</span>
</span><span id="__span-1-5"><a id="__codelineno-1-5" name="__codelineno-1-5" href="#__codelineno-1-5"></a>    <span class="o">...</span>
</span><span id="__span-1-6"><a id="__codelineno-1-6" name="__codelineno-1-6" href="#__codelineno-1-6"></a>    <span class="k">return</span> <span class="kc">False</span>
</span></code></pre></div>
